summary: Confessions of a Jonsa Shipper: If Jon and Sansa’s love scene isn’t on par with Robb and Talisa’s second love scene with those...
body: Confessions of a Jonsa Shipper: If Jon and Sansa’s love scene isn’t on par with Robb and Talisa’s second love scene with those gorgeous pan up body shots or on Grey Worm and Missandei’s beautiful vulnerability level then I don’t want it. If the show is going to do it at all it has to be on par or better than those two scenes because those were the best love scenes in the show!!

summary:
Davos: Jon about this jealousy over Sansa—
Jon: I don’t get jealous!
Davos: oh is that so? I guess you wouldn’t mind then...
body:
Davos: Jon about this jealousy over Sansa—

Jon: I don’t get jealous!

Davos: oh is that so? I guess you wouldn’t mind then if—

Jon: come within 100 feet of her and I’ll wear your skin as a cloak.

Davos: …

Jon: …

Jon: I’m working on it.

summary: I think in the s7 commentary dan and david said cersei and jon will share a scene or some scenes coming up.
question: I think in the s7 commentary dan and david said cersei and jon will share a scene or some scenes coming up.
answer:
Hey anon,

Did they? Hmm, I still don’t think that those photos were legit, in the sense that it looked staged. 

Again, if they are going to share a scene together, it’s most likely in the last half of the season. As to why they would meet, maybe Jon is going to try and negotiate an armistice. Give it one more try. That seems like something Jon would do. I can’t really think of anything else and no I don’t think people are getting kidnapped. 

TTFN

summary: I'm curious what you think will happen between Cersei and Jon next season. From what I know it seems like she and Jon will share...
question: I'm curious what you think will happen between Cersei and Jon next season. From what I know it seems like she and Jon will share some scenes together.
answer:
Hello anon,

I don’t think those pictures are real. They’ve been so careful all season to keep things under wraps that they aren’t going to just expose a major storyline for all the world to see. I believe @ladyofdragonstone has debunked the filming by showing that the camera used is not their regular filming camera. 

If there is any interaction between them it’ll be at the end of the season. Although I have my doubts they’ll interact at all. 

TTFN

TTFN

summary: I am currently rereading Jon's chapters in ADWD and I noticed that Jon has some striking parallels with Mance's son, Aemon. Both...
body:
I am currently rereading Jon’s chapters in ADWD and I noticed that Jon has some striking parallels with Mance’s son, Aemon.

  • Both are the secret offspring of royalty. Jon the son of Prince Rhaegar and Aemon the son of the King-Beyond-the-Wall, Mance Rayder.
  • Both of their fathers were well liked by their peers and had an affinity for music.
  • Both of their identities are hidden protect them from those that could harm them. Jon Snow from Robert and Aemon from Melisandre
  • Both are protected by Stark men. Ned for Jon and Jon for Aemon.
  • Both travel a great distance as an infant. From Dorne to the North for Jon and from the North to the Reach for Aemon.
  • Both had/will have men pretend that they are his bastard son. Ned for Jon and Sam to Aemon.
  • Both are born during a battle. Jon at Tower of Joy, and Aemon at the fight at the wall
  • Both their mothers were northern women who died in childbirth. Lyanna for Jon and Dalla for Aemon.
  • Both their wet nurses posed as the mother. Wylla for Jon and Gilly for Aemon.

Given all of these similarities, I doubt it’s just a coincidence that baby Aemon was named after a Targaryen.

It should be noted that the name Amon means ‘the hidden one’ in Egyptian. I believe that fits Jon’s hiding of baby Aemon from Melisandre. And if Jon was in fact named Aemon, then this would also fit him perfectly as another hidden prince.

blog.name: reddragon1995
blog.title: Jonerys Snowstorm Of House Stargaryen
blog.description: HE LOVED HER AND SHE LOVED HIM

body:
I could watch Dany rolling up to the Dragon Pit all day.


Look at them all, standing for their Queen. They know it.


Look at Jon, that face betrays a major boner. Look how excited he is. It’s the cutest thing ever.


Look at Cersei, trying and failing to be unimpressed.


Bow down, motherfuckers. Bend the knee.

summary: After all this delusional Jonsas speak about their stupid theories? and their argument about ‘’burn Tarly alive’’?
title: After all this delusional Jonsas speak about their stupid theories? and their argument about ‘’burn Tarly alive’’?
body:
Explanation of Tarlyes execution from Dave Hill 

‘’Every conqueror offers the choice of ‘bend the knee or die.’ These lords disobeyed her and disrespected her in rebellion against the rightful queen’’

‘’She’s gotten used to the technically-in-rebellion King in the North advising her. ‘’

‘‘ They’re both, in a way, cut from the same cloth — they’re both idealists ‘ ‘

‘’ They both care about the people they govern, which makes them unique in Westeros. ‘’

‘‘ All that that draws her to him. ‘‘

‘‘ He’s good hearted and would want to ‘break the wheel’ with her.”

reblog.comment:

‘’ They both care about the people they govern, which makes them unique in Westeros. ‘’

‘‘ All that that draws her to him. ‘‘

‘‘ He’s good hearted and would want to ‘break the wheel’ with her.”

‘’She’s gotten used to the technically-in-rebellion King in the North advising her. ‘’

blog.name: fortunatelylori
blog.title: Thoughts on the verge
blog.description:
Pretty much Game of Throne and Jonsa all day, every day. 
Avatar and header by @ragekitn

summary: can’t get past jon fathering a bastard. maybe to others it’s ironic or something, but there is just no way... where would this...
question: can’t get past jon fathering a bastard. maybe to others it’s ironic or something, but there is just no way... where would this “pure” baby even fit in the future? the dragons went mad because they knew they were dragons and felt entitled enough to keep their arrogance going. therefore jon was spared, being raised by wolves. what do you think that means for the wolf dragon blooded children from then on between sansa and jon? there shouldn’t be any coin flipping for them, right?
answer:
Hey, nonnie!

I agree. I have a pretty visceral reaction to the idea of Jon fathering a bastard for all the reasons I’ve detailed in other posts. I think on a purely narrative level, I get why people would think it could happen because it seems that this story sometimes insists in forcing their characters to live through their worst nightmares but at this point Jon has been hit with so many nightmares that I think there’s really no point in twisting the knife even further (pun intended). 

The reason why I don’t believe it will happen is because of D*ny’s arc as “mother of dragons” which would be at complete odds with her giving birth to a human baby. Also the exploration of what would happen to a half-Targ baby in a world where Targs are reviled has already been done with Jon and we will get the painful pay-off of that in season 8. 

So there are only a few reasons why this b0atie would come to pass: 

1. Gratuitous narrative punishment for Jon and putting Sansa in the same spot her mother occupied and forcing her to atone for Cat’s mistakes. As I’ve said there is no reason why Jon should be punished again. 

As for Sansa, first and foremost, she is not responsible for what Cat did or failed to do and the fact that she looks like her physically shouldn’t be an excuse. In addition she will already atone for Cat’s failures with Jon by protecting, loving and making him a Stark. So having to do that with a bastard Targ baby is overkill. 

Then there’s the simple matter that Sansa, just like Jon, has been through enough bitter experiences and while a baby is a baby and I’m sure she’d be a wonderful mother to him/her, there’s no reason to put her through another painful situation when we’re still waiting for the pay-off of having her finally be truly happy after 7 seasons of being hurt over and over again. 

2. History repeating itself - “Everything you will see is something you’ve seen before”. Cool … However, by that logic, we should have an entire story that simply just reverts back to the beginning and nothing of note truly changes. That would feel like an utter waste of time. 

3. Targ restoration - what is there to say on this, really? Jon/D*ny/b0atie rule Westeros in a frenzy of dragon fire, exceptionalism and “bend the knee or die” speeches. Which means that the entire focus on the Targaryens being fucked up, doing far more harm than good and essentially going mad that is not only present in the actually story but in each and every additional material GRRM has put out, was just done for funs and giggles. Nothing to concern yourself with. Aryan exceptionalism is actually the way forward for Westeros. If that’s the story I’ve been watching and reading, I’m going to consider that all my time analyzing it and taking it seriously would have been for nothing. 

what do you think that means for the wolf dragon blooded children from then on between sansa and jon? there shouldn’t be any coin flipping for them, right?

“When a Targaryen is born, the Gods flip a coin” is an in-story saying. It’s like us saying: “ Don’t bite the hand that feeds you“ or countless other such expressions. 

It came about because after a while people noticed that their inbred rulers weren’t quite right in the head and that by and large almost all of them ended up doing things that you could only equate to madness. I don’t think anyone did a statistical study to see if one in 2 Targs went mad or what the balance was exactly. 

If we look at each individual case, their symptoms differ from individual to individual. The one thing they have in common is their obsession with fire and dragons. There’s a case to be made that this hankers back to whatever blood magic ritual the Valyrians used to bond dragons to humans but for being half-Targ, Jon isn’t really plagued with dragon dreams or fantasies. Perhaps he will be once he comes into contact with them but I think his bond with Ghost will protect him from the negative effects of that particular symptom. 

The narrative import of  “When a Targaryen is born, the Gods flip a coin” is limited to Jon and D*ny specifically because they’re the only 2 Targs left so the duality of a coin flip is a way of foreshadowing Jon and D*ny in conflict and acting as foils for one another. 

As for Jon and Sansa’s potential children, it’s difficult to say much of anything. There’s of course the nature vs. nurture aspect that needs to be brought up. D*ny didn’t just become who she is in a vaccum. Her whole life experience lead her down this path and having no positive role models during her formative years informs her actions to this day. She lacks a moral compass in a way and despite her good intentions, she never manages to find it. 

Jon and Sansa’s children will, on the other hand, be brought up in a loving home by two moral and kind people so that’s bound to have an effect on how they view the world and what kind of people they end up being. On the other hand, every human being has flaws and perhaps some of their children will display what could be interpreted as Targ characteristics. The important thing is what they choose to focus on. 

Thanks for the ask!

reblog.comment:
Hey, nonnie!

I agree. I have a pretty visceral reaction to the idea of Jon fathering a bastard for all the reasons I’ve detailed in other posts. I think on a purely narrative level, I get why people would think it could happen because it seems that this story sometimes insists in forcing their characters to live through their worst nightmares but at this point Jon has been hit with so many nightmares that I think there’s really no point in twisting the knife even further (pun intended). 

The reason why I don’t believe it will happen is because of D*ny’s arc as “mother of dragons” which would be at complete odds with her giving birth to a human baby. Also the exploration of what would happen to a half-Targ baby in a world where Targs are reviled has already been done with Jon and we will get the painful pay-off of that in season 8. 

So there are only a few reasons why this b0atie would come to pass: 

1. Gratuitous narrative punishment for Jon and putting Sansa in the same spot her mother occupied and forcing her to atone for Cat’s mistakes. As I’ve said there is no reason why Jon should be punished again. 

As for Sansa, first and foremost, she is not responsible for what Cat did or failed to do and the fact that she looks like her physically shouldn’t be an excuse. In addition she will already atone for Cat’s failures with Jon by protecting, loving and making him a Stark. So having to do that with a bastard Targ baby is overkill. 

Then there’s the simple matter that Sansa, just like Jon, has been through enough bitter experiences and while a baby is a baby and I’m sure she’d be a wonderful mother to him/her, there’s no reason to put her through another painful situation when we’re still waiting for the pay-off of having her finally be truly happy after 7 seasons of being hurt over and over again. 

2. History repeating itself - “Everything you will see is something you’ve seen before”. Cool … However, by that logic, we should have an entire story that simply just reverts back to the beginning and nothing of note truly changes. That would feel like an utter waste of time. 

3. Targ restoration - what is there to say on this, really? Jon/D*ny/b0atie rule Westeros in a frenzy of dragon fire, exceptionalism and “bend the knee or die” speeches. Which means that the entire focus on the Targaryens being fucked up, doing far more harm than good and essentially going mad that is not only present in the actually story but in each and every additional material GRRM has put out, was just done for funs and giggles. Nothing to concern yourself with. Aryan exceptionalism is actually the way forward for Westeros. If that’s the story I’ve been watching and reading, I’m going to consider that all my time analyzing it and taking it seriously would have been for nothing. 

what do you think that means for the wolf dragon blooded children from then on between sansa and jon? there shouldn’t be any coin flipping for them, right?

“When a Targaryen is born, the Gods flip a coin” is an in-story saying. It’s like us saying: “ Don’t bite the hand that feeds you“ or countless other such expressions. 

It came about because after a while people noticed that their inbred rulers weren’t quite right in the head and that by and large almost all of them ended up doing things that you could only equate to madness. I don’t think anyone did a statistical study to see if one in 2 Targs went mad or what the balance was exactly. 

If we look at each individual case, their symptoms differ from individual to individual. The one thing they have in common is their obsession with fire and dragons. There’s a case to be made that this hankers back to whatever blood magic ritual the Valyrians used to bond dragons to humans but for being half-Targ, Jon isn’t really plagued with dragon dreams or fantasies. Perhaps he will be once he comes into contact with them but I think his bond with Ghost will protect him from the negative effects of that particular symptom. 

The narrative import of  “When a Targaryen is born, the Gods flip a coin” is limited to Jon and D*ny specifically because they’re the only 2 Targs left so the duality of a coin flip is a way of foreshadowing Jon and D*ny in conflict and acting as foils for one another. 

As for Jon and Sansa’s potential children, it’s difficult to say much of anything. There’s of course the nature vs. nurture aspect that needs to be brought up. D*ny didn’t just become who she is in a vaccum. Her whole life experience lead her down this path and having no positive role models during her formative years informs her actions to this day. She lacks a moral compass in a way and despite her good intentions, she never manages to find it. 

Jon and Sansa’s children will, on the other hand, be brought up in a loving home by two moral and kind people so that’s bound to have an effect on how they view the world and what kind of people they end up being. On the other hand, every human being has flaws and perhaps some of their children will display what could be interpreted as Targ characteristics. The important thing is what they choose to focus on. 

Thanks for the ask!
